DOC.brief_summary: To compare bioequivalence calcium acetate oral solution vs. calcium acetate gelcaps healthy volunteer calcium citrate positive control .
DOC.brief_title: Bioequivalence Study Comparing Calcium Acetate Oral Solution Versus Calcium Acetate Gelcaps Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Signed date informed consent form Ages : 1875 year Serum Calcium level 8.610.2 mg/dL 25 vitamin D level 20100 ng/mL 1 , 25 dihydroxy vitamin D level 662 pg/mL Fasting glucose level 6599 mg/dL ( min 8 hr fast ) iPTH level 1065 pg/mL Serum phosphorous level 2.54.5 mg/dL Albumin level 3.65.1 g/dL Sodium level 135146 mEq/L Potassium level 3.55.3 mEq/L Negative pregnancy test ( screen prior dose ) woman childbearing potential subject must agree use adequate contraception ( hormonal double barrier method ) study No clinically significant abnormality electrocardiogram ( ECG ) reading determine INVESTIGATOR No clinically significant abnormality liver function test No clinically significant abnormality CBC coagulation study No clinically significant abnormality kidney function ( eGFR use serum creatinine ) BMI 18.530 Subjects must agree consume alcohol treatment phase study Women pregnant breast feeding Malignancy except squamous cell carcinoma skin Documented current acute chronic disease Positive human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) , hepatitis B hepatitis C Myocardial infarction within 6 month study Day 0 Parathyroidectomy within 6 month study Day 0 Gastrointestinal disorder associate impaired absorption oral medication Inability swallow tablet tolerate calcium acetate oral solution Hormonal therapy ( except contraceptive ) , immunotherapy corticoid therapy Concurrent antibiotic treatment Any concurrent investigational treatment within 30 day screen Unable unwilling comply fully protocol Diuretic therapy Thiazides , Furosemide ( INN ) frusemide ( former BAN ) within one month screen Subjects take overthecounter ( OTC ) prescribe phosphorous calcium contain supplement Subjects test positive drug abuse
